Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Emily V
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and loved it. Less than a block away from the Champs Elysees and shopping, 5-10 minute walk to the Arc de Triumph, 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower, 30 minute walk to the Louve. The room was clean, comfortable, safe and pretty. We had a courtyard facing room and it was very quiet. The hotel is doors away from a great French bakery as well that we adore. It also has a small bar and breakfast area. We recommend using the L'Open Tour hop-on/off bus that stops very close to the hotel and has around 50ish stops.That made touring everything and getting back to our hotel super easy.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DaraU
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated close to the George V and Franklin D Roosevelt metro stops on Champs Elysees, on a rather anonymous sidestreet. Perfect location really! The whole hotel looks very modern in its interior design. We stayed in the smallest room, the Privilege room, on the second floor facing the street. The room was nicely decorated and everything about it felt quite new. It was of good size and had a queensized bed, an armchair, desk, flatscreen TV etc. The bathroom had a tub, but was quite small. Also the closet was minimal! The room had free Wifi, which was perfect for us. We didn't try the breakfast there (18 euro per person in march 2012), but chose to eat at the next door café. Even though the room faced the street it wasn't too noisy, but I suppose a room facing the courtyard would've been even better. There's not a lot to say, it's perfect for the independent traveller who is all about location, location, location and like the modern minimalistic style. Not ideal perhaps for someone looking for a hotel with charm and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cristal jevel”
Reviews.Author: wonder5
Reviews.Content: Nice surprise among overrated and to expensive hotels in Paris. This not a large hotel with big rooms, but for the price you actually get what you payed for. Friendly staff, clean, modern (a real refreshment as most hotels in Paris have barok style rooms). Take deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: sequitur
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cristal for 4 nights in February for a business trip. The hotel is incredibly convenient to both tourist attractions and the #1 metro line (George V stop). The metro stop is very important for business travelers commuting to the La Defense CBD, who don't want to stay in La Defense. The hotel is very clean and neat. I can't say enough about the staff and how helpful and friendly they were. While my French is not so good, they made every effort to communicate in English when possible. Additionally, I left my suit jacket in the closet upon departure. They kindly wrapped it and mailed it to me (for 19euros). The 2 negative things i would say are that the climate control system in the room sucks. It is either on or off, and since it was well below freezing outside the room was like a furnace. Also, if travelling with your wife, don't expect her to be "wow'd" by the accommodations. While nice and very, very clean, it does lack luxury. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: exotic_chick
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris for a work trip, and my husband joined me on the weekend for some fun time (on our dime). We booked the Cristal online. Although it isn't cheap, considering its location (very close to the Champs Elysees) and the fact that there's free wifi, you can't beat that! The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. We'd probably stay there again if we wanted to be in that area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all and yet...”
Reviews.Author: snowman40
Reviews.Content: Located right on the Champs Elysees, the newly renovate Cristal is certainly bright. Rue Washington is a fairly unpromising looking road, but the hotel is close enough to the CE end (200 metres maybe?) located amongst a smattering of cafes, restaurants and offices. The reception doesn't look much like a hotel with just one big desk in the middle of the room which is brightly lit and coloured and fronted with a big glass window. The look is uncompromisingly modern and very bright, but scratch a little deeper and things don't seem quite so 'new' (The life for instance creaks and rattles). My room, on the 3rd floor was quite roomy for Paris (where the norm is SMALL!) and comfortable. The bathroom was newly refitted and there was a large double bed, decent sized wardrobe and a decent sized TV with a good picture (not always true in Paris, I find). The selection of channels was disappointing as usual for an English speaker (and French TV seems pretty dire on the whole from what I've seen, especially if you don't speak French). Breakfast was served in the basement as a fairly generous buffet (juices, coffee, croissants, cheeses, cold meats, etc - and boiled eggs). The room again was bright and colourful, but did feel like a basement, I'm afraid. I slept well the two nights I was in the hotel (although the walls aren't that thick - I could clearly hear the TV in the room next door on the second night) and found it generally comfortable and conveniently situated for the Champs Elysees area. However, despite my generally positive experience nothing made me feel I want to stay in the hotel again. I certainly won't mind if I do, but I won't be asking for it specifically. Perhaps part of this was down to the staff. They were all courteous, but totally business-like (except the Porter who grabbed my bags without asking and then pointedly hung around my room until I tipped him - Everyone has to earn a living, but I can carry my own tiny suitcase...) and with little friendliness. I've given it 3 stars, although that seems a little harsh, even to me. The rating really reflects the price and the hotel's supposedly 4 star rating - Although nothing was bad about it, it just didn't leave a really positive impression on me. M

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Nikolaos P
Reviews.Content: I did not really like the colours, but the hotel as such is just perfect! Functionally and comprehensively equipped room, top breakfast quality, helpful & likeable staff. Excellent starting point for city trips and close to metro station. Reasonable price-performance ratio. Authentic restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Michael O
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was such a fantastic find. My girlfriend and I stayed for 3 nights in room 3 and loved it from the moment we arrived. I'd read many reviews of people moaning about the size of the rooms/lobbies/lifts in Parisian hotels, but that's all part of the charm as far as we were concerned. Yes the lift is only big enough for 2 people but this isn't a problem as a member of staff takes your luggage and meets you at your room. Yes the room was compact but our bed was large and very comfortable, the decor funky, the layout ergonomically ideal, the bathroom was very spacious with his and hers vanity sinks and a double shower, the carpet thick and soft and above all the whole room was very clean. It didn't matter which member of staff was present at reception, all were incredibly accommodating, friendly and spoke excellent English for those of you who may be reluctant to dabble in conversing 'en Francais'. The hotel is an ideal base to explore Paris, turn right out of the hotel and walk 50 yards and you are on the Champs Elysees; turn right again and you are looking straight at l'Arc de Triomphe. From here you are 10-15 min walk from the Eiffel Tower. Turn left on the Champs Elysees and you are 10-15 min straight walk from le Louvre and 25 min walk from Notre Dame. The hotel is situated in one of the most affluent parts of Paris which makes it even more of a bargain in our opinion. Le Lido (highly recommend) is just round the corner, Louis Vitton (for those of you who wish to queue to look at a handbag!) is opposite on George V Avenue so lots of good shops, funky bars and restaurants with the Metro, taxi rank and bus stop virtually right outside the hotel. On booking my girlfriend had notified the hotel it was my 30th during our stay. On returning to the room on our first night from le Lido, the hotel had left a magnum of champagne on the bed with a greeting card wishing me a pleasurable stay. A very nice touch gratefully received. If you are looking for a comfortable hotel in a great location, with excellent staff who are willing to do that little bit extra, we highly recommend this place. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Nikizuk
Reviews.Content: The service was great, Hugo at front desk was a BIG help in our stay, the location is very good, but the rooms are ver small, even for Paris standards..

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: USTravelerChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cristal towards the end of our honeymoon as our original hotel was not ready (new hotel) and we were sent to the Cristal hotel for our Paris stay. While the hotel is located really close to the Champs Elysees, the hotel is just ok. We arrived and were quickly checked into our room. The rooms are decorated in strong colors, but they are relatively normal in terms of size. Our room's air conditioning unit did not blow any cold air and we made the staff aware of the problem. When we returned from Versailles tired and ready for bed, we found out that the unit was not fixed and the room was boiling hot. We had to sleep with the windows open and heard all the street noise below. Needless to say, they never fixed the unit, which is a shame since it is suppose to be a 4 star hotel. Honestly, I think they did not wanted the expense to fix it. They said the "technician" could not fix it, but were never offered another room or any other resolution. I also asked if they could print our boarding passes and the staff at the front desk said they could not, whcih did not make any sense to me, but I guess they did not want to be bothered. The breakfast was ok, most cold items like juice, fruit, etc. I have stayed at other hotels in Paris over the years and this hotel is not one that I would stay at again given the price. We stayed at the Hotel Royal Saint Honore near the Louvre last summer and it was much better and cheaper than the Cristal.

Reviews.Title: “very small”
Reviews.Author: Diana8207
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good, but the room are very very small, even for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lovesick78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights.It was the best time for our holiday.All the staff were very warm,charming and helpful.The room was clean, comfortable and quite.Breakfast was a good selection of food,free wifi in the room.In addition the location is great,which was close to shopping center,restaurant and famous tourist attraction.Itâ€™s really the best service,they never sayâ€�NO â€œwith customers.They work so hard to make sure my stay here was perfect.I enjoyed my every singer day here and hope to be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Christian_Jacobs
Reviews.Content: We recommend this place to anyone who wants to be close enough to the heart of the city of romance and enjoy the warm welcome and great service of the amazing staff! Very kind and helpful people! It was nice to return to the hotel after long day of activities and sight seeing in the city. We will be back most def!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, boutique hotel, helpful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: littlemg
Reviews.Content: Cristal is located in a street just a turn from Champ-Elysee so it's very convenient for travelers to just catch all the goods thing in Paris. The hotel itself is new and full of design, clean and cozy! And the staff are very friendly and helpful, especially thanking for Franck and Lydia, for helping me send back my clothes that I left behind in the hotel after I went back to my home town. Good place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely well placed hotel just off the main street....!”
Reviews.Author: benismindless
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our second trip to Paris for our wedding... Our room was a descent size and we found the staff very helpful and friendly... We arrived first thing in the morning 7:30am when we were not due to check in until 2pm. This was not a problem for the man at at the front desk and we were shown to our room straight away. The free wifi is great and the breakfast was really good but just a little overpriced. Has everything you need though. Really good location close to all the sights and the metro for getting around. Would recommend this hotel to a first timer to Paris for the location. Very Nice...

Reviews.Title: “Only ok”
Reviews.Author: natnath
Reviews.Content: A decent small boutique hotel in a great location. The location of this hotel is it's selling point. Off the champs elyses right by the arc dtriamph. Very near metro so everything is accessible. The deco is very modern and quirky. Not much else is great. The room sizes are very small as is the lobby area which is not apparent from the photos. The staff are not very clued up on tourist spots nor very friendly. The view from the room is of some back ally. We tried. To order room service but the very small menu was in an un-understandable English and when I asked him to explain to me the food items he had no idea. We were out of the hotel almost all day everyday and so it was ok but for the price we paid I was let down

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: DaveBush19
Reviews.Content: Needed to be in Paris for a few days for work. Tried to get a hotel in the business district of La Defense with no luck so the Champs Elysees area was recommended due to direct Metro link to La Defense. I have to say I'm really pleased I went for this choice as the Business District is really lack lustre, but here you have the best of both worlds being a minutes walk to the Champs Elysee, 10 minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe yet only 10-15 minutes by Metro to La Defense. Also this hotel is really individual and funky, certainly not what you would find in a regular chain hotel. It's all very clean and new. The staff are very helpful and didn't mind printing a boarding pass out for me. My only small gripe is that the breakfast was an average buffet style, for an extra cost and next time I might go to a nearby patisserie instead. If you are coming here on holiday, then this is an ideal launchpad to the rest of the Paris sites ( I didn't get much chance for this myself).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: HJPofi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the eighth more than 5 times for pleasure trips and this hotel worked very well for out 10 day recent trip. The staff was friendly and the location was perfect. One block off the Champs and right next to the Georges V metro. We had an issue with the room being very hot and that was never resolved. Bad planning from the design side I think. The room was not to small. We had number 45 and it was a "prestige" double. the bathrooom was small but acceptable. each room is different as I found out so it pays to ask for a floor plan. The front desk helped with making dinner reservations and were, as I said, friendly. Would I stay here again? Yes, if I couldn't find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful discovery”
Reviews.Author: la_russe
Reviews.Content: My company's travel coordinator set up my recent trip 4 day trip to Paris where I had a delightful surprise staying at the Cristal; my room was very quiet, wonderful bed, soft yet crisp sheets; the bathroom was really lovely, too, everything was exceptionally clean. The entire room was designed remarkably, very stylish and ingenious use of space. I appreciated all the little touches and attention to details which takes the stress off being on a business trip; a very helpful and courteous staff, and good with recommendations for restaurants, cafes. The location could not be better, near everything. I look forward to returning to my Parisian discovery!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: SupremeBurgerFan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right off the champs elysees and a very short walk to the georges V metro stop, and a short walk to the arc de triomphe. The location is fantastic especially when you consider the value pricing. I stayed for two nights and didn't get breakfast at the hotel (other than coffee) so i can't speak for that. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful, and spoke english, which was good because my french is basically nonexistent. They supplied me with a power adaptor (free) and were helpful when i asked questions. The location is on a small side street and next door to a cash machine, a small brasserie and a great small bistro/bar. The rooms are small by comparison to US standards, but I've stayed in smaller rooms in europe before. More importantly, the room was clean and VERY quiet considering the location - bed was quite comfortable. The only complaint is that the free Wifi was a bit dodgy - seemed to lose the connection at random intervals which was a bit tough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excelent location, good staff.”
Reviews.Author: Newton A
Reviews.Content: I have been at Cristal Hotel for 04 nights along with my wife, brothers, family. Hotel is so clean, very well placed and comfortable. Price is quite high for the size of offered room (small as mostly of ParisÂ´s hotels), however, location, cleanness, bed, bathroom and staff offset the value. IÂ´ll be definitely hosted at Cristal on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nifty, but quite expensive for its size”
Reviews.Author: bewitching
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for a one weekend stay and ended up choosing Cristal Hotel because of its location. Since I was traveling solo and coming from a train ride from Gare de Lyon, its nearness to an RER station (George V) was very convenient. It wasn't hard to find, and I like the fact that when I get out from the hotel to walk towards Champs Elysees, the LV Flagship store is right across :) As for the hotel, it's really small, just a lowrise building smacked along rue Washington. Receptionist was accommodating, spoke a great deal of English. I got a "Privilege Room" (based from their website, as my room was colored purple), which is basically small in size, but I found it pretty and complete. Really couldn't complain much--bed was great, flat screen tv on the wall, minibar, safe, etc. I especially liked the bathroom, it also had purple floor tiles and a matching wall pattern. I guess the only thing I didn't like was the view from my room, not much to look at. And oh, the next morning, after buffet breakfast (not yet part of the room price), when I went back to my room, I realized my door didn't lock. I called to have someone check it, and apparently, it was broken all along, since the night before. But I guess the place was indeed safe enough, since I didn't miss anything or heard noises while sleeping and the fact I was still alive haha. All in all it was the ideal place for a solo traveler (female especially), but the price is still hefty. It's more expensive than the 5-star hotel I stayed at in Geneva, but then again, Paris is Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast not included!”
Reviews.Author: Peazy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the second portion of our Paris trip for 7 nights. It has a very modern feel with the paint job in the room being done to resemble crystals and a broken mirror designed to be crystal like. It isn't the best look, it's kind of goofy, but the room was clean and decent sized for Europe (small for American). The bed was sort of comfortable. It only had a comforter and no sheet, I don't really like that style, otherwise it was comfortable enough. The internet was frustrating. It wasn't that fast and in their quest for uber-security they only let one password work for one device, so when I used my iphone that code no longer worked for my laptop, ever. The location to us was less than desirable, but I would think others may really like it. It is right off the Champs de Elysees. This is a high traffic, super touristy area. I mean really touristy. We stayed on Saint Louis L'ile before this and we liked that quiet, less crowded feel much more, both are equally easy to get to transportation and sights. The thing that really burned me about this place was the breakfast. When we checked in they told us breakfast is included with your room and downstairs. So we had breakfast, it's a pretty simple affair, pastries, lunchmeats, cereal, coffee, fruit and soft boiled eggs. Basically a free continental breakfast at many hotels. Upon checkout they charged us 17 euro each, per day for the breakfast! When I explained they told us it was included they simply shrugged. I think they use this tactic to goose the room rate. It seemed very unethical to me and I cannot recommend a place that behaves like that. If the breakfast was extravigant and had bacon, champagne, foie gras, etc, I would have been cool and understood, but for what you got I just really felt ripped off. We were much happier in our other hotel, the Hotel Des Deux Iles.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: lorrainelowe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of September. The location could not be better, just off the Champs Elysees and a few minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe. Walk in the other direction and you hit Place de la Concorde, Tuileries gardens then the Louvre. The hotel has a real funky style throughout that puts a smile on your face. Breakfast was excellent, just right to set you up for the day. The room was small but comfortable and exactly whay you need for a city break. It was completely quiet, despite being off such a busy street. Staff were polite and helpful. Overall an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love it !!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beau_u
Reviews.Content: enjoy everything except bathroom that hasn't got separated place or slide door to protect wet floor. close to metro, LV champs elysees see photos

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms are just too small”
Reviews.Author: jbwardi
Reviews.Content: Cristal hotel is a very nicely designed hotel in terms of looks with a great location. The rooms are nice and extremely clean. Only thing is that the rooms are very small even for Paris, only me and my wife and two suitcases and we had a lot of trouble moving in the room. The bathroom was small also with a sliding glass door which is half clear glass half colored, now with me and my wife i don't really mind..but if your going with a friend in a double room...i don't know if you wanna have to see that. As i said the location of the hotel is great, but if you have a room on the main road, then your gonna have some trouble since right in front of the hotel is a Iranian restaurant which turns into a club at night...your gonna hear it! The staff were not that great..not too friendly and seem to like to pass any request to the next guy on duty if possible, had to request a booking for a restaurant three times cuz they keep passing it to the next guy in line. All-in-all i would say its not that bad..but i would look for another hotel on my next visit to Pairs.

Reviews.Title: “colourful, excellent location, friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: PaoloBA
Reviews.Content: Very close to the metro. Silentful and confort for bed and bathroom. Small room, but great organization of the space. Very friendly the concierge. Expensive the breakfast. We had a good occasion for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel but Tiny Rooms at Steep Price”
Reviews.Author: HenryAbott
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel are as follows: modern, hip, clean, lovely staff and in a great part of town but on the downside, the rooms are on the small side and it is a pretty costly for what you're getting (value added facilities are limited at this hotel). But it's location for nightlife and fine restaurants, as well as so very close to the Metro and the excellent Ligne 1, is brilliant, so well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in an OK location”
Reviews.Author: 45Braveheart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights whilst in Paris for the France-Ireland rugby match. Just off the Champs-Ellysees, not far from tthe Arc de Triomphe, this hotel offers an OK location to base yourself from if you are sight-seeing in the North of the city. The rooms are clean & brightly decorated, but a bit cramped in size. (Some would say the norm for Paris). The hotel staff were not overly helpful with directions, and the map they offered us was so small it was almost useless. For the price we paid I would have expected better, and I suggest you will find it if you look for it.

Reviews.Title: “Super Cost-Benefit Value”
Reviews.Author: Worlderman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Cristal Champs Elysees cannot be beat given its location near Paris' most important boulevard and the hotel's affordable room rates! Really enjoyed staying there and will definitely return in the near future!! George Washington would have loved it too !!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: Waltz223
Reviews.Content: Was in Paris for business. The location near the RER made it easy to get to La Defense. Though in a busy part of town, the street was quiet. Staff was attentive and the Russian speaking concierge proved very helpful on several occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Location, design, comfort and internet...”
Reviews.Author: RobertKLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: Having no time to get myself familiar with Paris, this was the best location. Thanks to the concierge, i was able to go around easily. Rooms were super clean. The modern design is definitely unique and warm. It just felt good...

HotelInfo.Name: Cristal Champs Elysees
HotelInfo.Address: 9 Rue de Washington, Paris, France (Formerly Hotel Modern Elysees)
